summary:
I am an early career researcher with a graduate degree and three years of experience in development and humanitarian settings in research (quantitative and qualitative) and implementation. I am particularly interested in participatory and inclusive research for creating positive social impact. 

I have working experience in South-East Asian countries, having worked in Myanmar, Thailand, and Vietnam. I have also worked in in Europe and Africa (Uganda), and I have worked with a wide range of stakeholders, at the leadership level, with Governments, donors, and institutions, and at working levels with Civil Society Organizations, NGOs, and UN entities.

profile_positions.description:
I am working on a collaboration project between the University of Groningen and TYM Microfinance in Vietnam aimed at developing and testing an intervention aimed at supporting the development of women in Northern Vietnam. I explore different cultural values in Vietnam and test which approach is most effective for supporting women's empowerment.  

I use qualitative research to guide the intervention design, and I then test the intervention’s impact using experimental methods; a lab-in-the-field experiment and a Randomized Control Trial (RCT).

profile_positions.description:
Technical advisor and coordinator for EU-funded implementation-research consortium project “Scaling Up on Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs) in Southeast Asia”;
- Coordinated and provided technical input for Myanmar implementation and research plans, ensuring efficient program implementation and evaluation.
- Lead research and project evaluation with paper submissions in international peer-reviewed journals. 
- Lead the development of a data collection system at community level using DHIS2 for Vietnam and Myanmar. 
- Coordinating activities across local teams (local partners, including local public institutions and implementing partners), national stakeholders (Government of Myanmar, WHO national representative), international partners (European partners, other country teams), and donors. 

HelpAge representative on nutrition and food security;
- Acted as organization representative in INGO/CSO food security forum Scaling-up on Nutrition Civil Society Alliance, 
- Supported UN-led technical task force for adaptation of the Multi-Sectoral National Plan of Action for Nutrition (MS-NPAN), providing technical input on nutrition-sensitive education activities.
- Represented the organization as a technical member of the WHO-led task force working on Food-Based Dietary Guideline development for Myanmar.

profile_positions.description:
Conducted a cost-effectiveness analysis of the Napneung project, a research project aimed at testing new methods to increase the uptake of testing and counseling services for HIV, hepatitis B and C and syphilis in the public health system in Thailand. 

Engaged with Government, medical specialists, vulnerable communities, and health donors to develop a cost-effectiveness study of HIV screening for high-risk communities in Thailand (sex workers, MSM, people who inject drugs, Myanmar migrants), to provide recommendations to international and national health actors.

Presented research results to various audiences; research unit director and medical staff, donors, and external project evaluators (namely to the director of AIDES, previously Vice-Chair of the Global Fund), which contributed to the renewal of a grant from Initiative 5%, Expertise France.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Coup & Canvas is a concept that started with a few individuals who had a common desire to support Myanmar in difficult times. 

It has become a non-profit business working with Myanmar artists to raise funds for the people of Myanmar (through humanitarian aid) by using innovative ways such; as production of items (tote bags, posters, postcards) with art work and international sales, campaigns engaging artists and selling their art work online, online auctions, and more.
